gsw_content_information.article:
To view AWS Systems Manager Change templates
  1. Log in to your ServiceNow instance as a user (for example, System Administrator) in the fulﬁller view (standard user interface view).
  2. In the navigator, enter AWS Service Management Connector.
  3. Choose Change Templates under AWS Systems Manager, to show a list of all synched Change templates
To view AWS Systems Manager Change Request
  1. Log in to your ServiceNow instance as a user (for example, System Administrator) in the fulﬁller view (standard user interface view).
  2. In the navigator, enter AWS Service Management.
  3. Choose Change Requests under AWS Systems Manager, to show a list of all synched Change Requests created from ServiceNow
  4. Choose a Change Request to open the record
To view AWS Systems Manager Change Request Ops Items
  1. Log in to your ServiceNow instance as a user (for example, System Administrator) in the fulﬁller view (standard user interface view).
  2. In the navigator, enter AWS Service Management.
  3. Choose Change Request Ops Items under AWS Systems Manager, to show a list of all synched Change Requests created from ServiceNow
  4. Choose an Ops Item to open the record

To view AWS Systems Manager Change Request CloudTrail Events and Resources

  1. Log in to your ServiceNow instance as a user (for example, System Administrator) in the fulﬁller view (standard user interface view).
  2. In the navigator, enter AWS Service Management.
  3. Choose Change Requests under AWS Systems Manager, to show a list of all synched Change Requests created from ServiceNow
  4. Choose a Change Request to open the record
  5. Click the Sync CloudTrail Events button at the top right of the form or the link at the bottom of the form to trigger synchronization of CloudTrail Events and Resources
  6. Once the synchronization process has completed CloudTrail Events associated with the Change Request will appear in the tab marked CloudTrail Events at the bottom of the form
  7. Click on the Event Id of a CloudTrail Event to open a form showing the details of the CloudTrail Event
  8. Resources affected by this event are shown in a section marked CloudTrail Event Resources at the bottom of the form
To create AWS Systems Manager Change Manager Change
  1. Log in to your ServiceNow instance as a user (for example, System Administrator) in the fulﬁller view (standard user interface view).
  2. In the navigator, enter Change
  3. Choose Create New to view the various Change options
  4. Choose Create AWS Systems Manager Change Manager Change: Make changes to AWS resources using Change Manager Templates
  5. Select the runbook to be executed
  6. Fill all required fields
  7. Click Submit to create a ServiceNow Change Request
  8. Click on Request Approval to send approval requests to members of the Assignment group
  9. Once the change is approved, it moves to a Scheduled state
  10. Click on Implement
  11. Scroll to the bottom and view Change Tasks under related lists to view the Change task associated with Automation Execution
  12. Once the Change Execution is completed, the change moves to a Closed state
gsw_content_information.sys_name: AWS Systems Manager Change Manager integration features
gsw_content_information.title: AWS Systems Manager Change Manager integration features
